**Problem 1 (3pts)** Let $f(y) = 3y^2$ for $0 \leq y \leq 1$. 

a. Find $F(y)$
b. Find $P(0.4 < Y < 0.7)$
c. Find the mean of $Y$

### Solution

$f(y)=3y^2,\ 0\le y\le 1$.

(a)  
$$
F(y)=\begin{cases}
0, & y<0,\\[4pt]
\displaystyle\int_0^y 3t^2\,dt = y^3, & 0\le y\le 1,\\[6pt]
1, & y>1.
\end{cases}
$$

(b)  
$$
P(0.4<Y<0.7)=F(0.7)-F(0.4)=0.7^3-0.4^3=0.343-0.064=0.279.
$$

(c)  
$$
E[Y]=\int_0^1 y\cdot 3y^2\,dy=\int_0^1 3y^3\,dy=\left[\frac{3y^4}{4}\right]_0^1=\frac{3}{4}.
$$


**Problem 2 (2pts)** Consider a new random variable with the following cdf 
$$F(y) =
\begin{cases}
0, & y < 0, \\[6pt]
1 - e^{-y}, & y \ge 0 
\end{cases}
$$

a. Find $f(y)$
b. Find the 90th percentile of $Y$

### Solution

(a)  
$$
f(y)=F'(y)=\begin{cases}0,&y<0,\\[4pt]e^{-y},&y>0.\end{cases}
$$

(b) 90th percentile: set $F(y) = 0.9$ and solve for $y$:  
$$
1-e^{-y}=0.9\ \Rightarrow\ e^{-y}=0.1\ \Rightarrow\ y=-\ln(0.1)= 2.3026.
$$
